website_summaries.verdict: This label maker does a good job when printing standard labels but lags behind competitors when printing fancier or more complex labels.
pros: Stands out for its smaller margins, allowing it to make a variety of labels with smaller margins for less waste
cons: A handful of consumers gripe about the print quality, particularly when attempting to print labels with curved lines

customer_reviews.title: My old Dymo was WAY better -- steer clear of this one
customer_reviews.text: If you like non-intuitive buttons, ugly fonts, and especially uneven, shoddy print, then this is the printer for you! If not, steer clear. Oh, and the print cartridge that came with the unit malfunctioned from the get-go: the tape never came out, just jammed in the cartridge. The only reason I saw the crappy printing was because I ordered extra cartridges, which are also going back. Ugh. What a waste of time -- but thankfully Amazon is refunding the purchase. I'm going back to Dymo.
customer_reviews.author: Bake Woman

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty great. It makes very high-quality labels
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty great. It makes very high-quality labels; clear, reasonably durable, and very convenient. It has a lot of options for changing font size and layout, which I like. There's a minor learning curve, but for the most part operation is intuitive. I knocked off a star for a few reasons: 1. This thing takes 6 AAA batteries. That's a lot, and AAAs aren't cheap. 2. Several of the fonts attempt to be a little more stylized than the standard sans-serif. They don't work well at all. They're far too pixilated to convey the curves of a more natural script. If you're looking for function, these labels are fine. If you're looking for form, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uses special AC adapter, not the one recommended here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Good handheld label maker, a little difficult to figure out how to operate at first, but the instructions are fairly clear. I only gave it 3 stars because the AC power adapter recommended here on Amazon does not work, and since I didn't use it until 3 months after purchase it's too late to return. If you want to use an AC adapter try to find the one recommended in the instructions, (APT0615Z1-1) The instructions warn of possible damage if any other adapter is used.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Magee

customer_reviews.title: My First Labeler!
customer_reviews.text: Super EASY to use! I LOVE that this product line has "iron on", "glow in the dark" and regular label tapes! I bought a few of each!!!! It has some VERY pretty borders/frames for the text as well! I also love that you can choose between different fonts and write in two lines! This is so awesome! Loving it! The only down side is that when you place a border your text, I feel like it wastes some of the tape by leaving too much empty space at the beginning and end of the label, so I might actually stop using the frames because of it. :( But it's still a really cool machine!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Clenin

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the office!
customer_reviews.text: There is so much you can do with this label maker. It's been a really nice tool for us to have in our office. It's been in use for over two years now and it's been flawless. Easy to find replacement cartridges, and the amount of function that it provides is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Backcountry Exposure

customer_reviews.title: A really good label maker
customer_reviews.text: This label maker does a fine job. Several adjustments to get the font looking right on the label is a bit fiddly compared to the Brother P-Touch I used to have. But the brother's white laminated tapes were discontinued and generic replacements didn't stick well. So a bit of a learning curve with the Epson. The backings of the tapes are split down the center which tends to leave a mark when the label is put in place. Over all, I think I will like this label maker the more I use it. Memory feature allows you to save settings for future labels, which is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hagen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! I use this label maker all the time to prepare simple container labeling at work. The only customization I've needed is to make the font size larger, and that was easy enough to figure out. Easy machine to use. The back of the label maker has "Quick Tips". The machine comes with a small roll of label tape - I'm not really sure exactly how much. I made about 20 labels before I ran out, and the labels ranged from 1.5" to about 4" in length. Definitely buy a roll at the same time you buy the machine.
customer_reviews.author: JulesJC

customer_reviews.title: Why the wasteful plastic overload?
customer_reviews.text: Our planet is awash in plastic. Yes, I know, it's hard to avoid having to buy items that use it or are made from it. Still, I could not believe the inherently wasteful design of the replacement tape cartridges for these Epson label printers. Aren't the engineers at Epson smart enough to design replacement cartridges that don't create so much single-use plastic waste? This borders on criminal. I already have enough guilt ordering things from Amazon, with all the single-use packaging they throw at us. This label maker is just too much for me, however. I have to draw a line somewhere. Come on Epson! Get smarter!
customer_reviews.author: Philip AA

customer_reviews.title: I love labeling. I would label my bf in his ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a personal organizer and this suits all my labeling needs. I love labeling. I would label my bf in his sleep if he wasn't so twitchy.
customer_reviews.author: ebay buyer 12345

customer_reviews.title: does everything i need at a great price
customer_reviews.text: i don't have any complaints for this device. it's a basic label maker. it has different fonts and frames but i'm too lazy to change them (it's a bit cumbersome); i just picked a favorite or two and it saves the last setting during power downs. i just wish it told you how long (in inches) the label will be before you print it, as well as let me center words using the 2-line format (i've resorted to counting letters in each word and adding appropriate # of spaces before/after the shorter of the 2 lines).
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Text quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: If you are wanting to print text, the first item on your list should be print quality; at least it's first on my list. The print from this label maker is not smooth but is jagged -- looks much like the old dot matrix printers. I expected print quality like a laser printer (yes, I know this is not a laser printer). The print is easy to read, just looks sloppy up close. I NOW see other reviewers have noted this deficiency. I have owned a P-touch printer that had crisp lettering which is why I expected the same from this printer (P-touch printer was TERRIBLE in handling the label cassettes -- would never buy another one).
customer_reviews.author: WillO

customer_reviews.title: Now I am organized ( well almost )
customer_reviews.text: Mine is almost one year old and works like it is brand new . It uses batteries ( 6 AAA ) but you seldom have to change them and this allows you to move the printer around without unplugging and re-plugging in a cord .Keyboard is big enough for fat fingers . You can use two lines if space is an issue, the letters will be half the size of a single line label Cassette tape cartridge makes changing tape effortless Built in label cutter works perfect 2 BIG HINTS 1) order extra label tape with unit ..... 2) try black backround with white letters tape for better visabilty
customer_reviews.author: clyde caddy

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest thing ever. Total disaster. The tape kept getting stuck and nothing worked. I would have been better off just writing the words myself.
customer_reviews.author: K&J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teacher, essential oils, and diy.
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is perfect for me. I have labeled school supplies, kitchen items, and essential oil bottles. The labels are solid and stay put. They are great even when they get damp or oily. This one allows for plenty of creativity and fun with a variety of borders, symbols, fonts, and sizes.
customer_reviews.author: KKaur

customer_reviews.title: double or hard press??
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I have a defective item but I notice screen is too dark can't brighten it and when I press some buttons at times it doesn't register the letter(s) on the screen, so I either have to press hard or do it the second time to show on the screen. I thought maybe it was just me being a light presser, but others (family and friends) notice the same when they do it. I'll probably return and get the 400 model. Otherwise cool icons and letters and so forth.
customer_reviews.author: ETop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Label maker on steroids. It's great!
customer_reviews.text: This is like a label maker on steroids. It does so many different things, I'm STILL learning all the functions and I've had it for months! All that to say, though, it really is user friendly and easy to learn...it just takes a while to go through all it's capabilities, apparently! I had a basic label maker before this one that worked fine, but I wanted to upgrade and this is definitely a huge upgrade! For someone who is label obsessed (*ahem*, like me), this is the best thing ever. So many options, so much fun to mess around with. Makes organizing 10x better!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool; Functions Are Confusing at First
customer_reviews.text: Another staple in my office. I like the compact size, but the functions are a bit confusing until you get used to them. For example, if you hit the Font Size button, you have to first select how many lines you want on the label. It isn't clear how to get past that screen to get to the font size option. Also, I am unable to select the smallest font size. Not sure why. Otherwise it works great. Prints cleanly and clearly. Ink doesn't smudge. Cartridges last a long time for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B.

customer_reviews.title: FOR LABEL LOVERS
customer_reviews.text: My old, cheapo labeler gave up the ghost, so I bought the Epson online because of the Epson reputation for quality. What a difference! I love this labeler, and can't find enough things to put labels on. It's so easy to use, there are lots of choices of fonts, sizes, and even number of repeats (if you happen to own a business where like merchandise needs labeling multiple times). The BEST THING about this labeler is that the backing of the tape is so easily to peel off. It's a great detail that's so time-saving and helpful. I only hope that refills for this Epson will be easy to obtain. All in all, though, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: rkgnyc

customer_reviews.title: Happy Label Maker User
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it to help label some plastic containers used for storage in my basement and to label my son's tupperware containers for preschool. All-in-all, without reading the instruction manual...figured out how to get the tape in the machine, increase the size and case of the text and print out labels easily. If you are looking to print out quick labels - you might want a faster labeler...this is relatively slow at printing (based on my expectations of what faster would be). I would buy this again! I suggest the labels that are white with black lettering and can be used in dishwasher, etc. Just wish Staples.com would carry the Epson labels.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Good except no power cable in box sort of sucks.
customer_reviews.text: It writes labels, the ink doesn't smudge, the labels stick to things. It's really easy to use, and the tapes of label stuff are cheap... So yeah. it's great. Oh- I do wish it CAME WITH the power cord though.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, wonderful options!
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a label maker before and I love how well it prints out. I am using it for a photo album for my son. It took a bit of time to master the different icons, features, but once learned, it does a great job. I certainly recommend it for any project. The included tape is more than just a sample. It created labels for the entire 100 or so page photo album and I still have tape left. The replacement tapes aren't cheap, but I really enjoy the fact the printout is much better than anything I could handwrite!
customer_reviews.author: cpareviewlady

customer_reviews.title: but it would really benefit from a backlit display and would be nice if they threw in a transformer to be able ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but it would really benefit from a backlit display and would be nice if they threw in a transformer to be able to plug it in rather than consuming batteries (the unit already has a DC power input jack...just doesn't come with the adapter).
customer_reviews.author: K. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than the Dymo
customer_reviews.text: I had a Dymo label maker that broke after about a year. It really made me mad since I had invested so much in the tape. I refused to buy another one even though I was wasting the money I had in the tape. I bought this Epson and I am very glad I did. It is easier to use, has more fonts, wastes less tape and has a better feel to it. It is just a better product in my opinion. I am surprised that it uses AAA batteries. I wish it would use AA since they are more common and have more energy.
customer_reviews.author: M.Splt

customer_reviews.title: I've named it, Junior
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this was an impulse buy but I have never been happier with an impulsively bought item than this label maker. It's amazing and easy to use. I used the starter tape to test it out and get comfortable with the keys and honestly after reading the instructions once I figured the rest out for myself. Very straightforward. I still have plenty of starter tape.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kettle

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is one great label maker! So much better then the one we had before. The label length is just right too. You don't get too much waste at the beginning or the end of the label. It is being used in an office and the keyboard is very easy to navigate and changing fonts or other things is really easy. If you wish to get fancy, there are a myriad of borders too. Being in an office, we don't really need that function but the ability to change the font and font size AND, print 2 rows is fantastic! I highly recommend this little Label Maker. You will love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Trueblood

customer_reviews.title: Great Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: I received this label maker in time for a cookout I was hosting. So, I used it to label everyone's cups! There is literally no learning curve on this compact unit. My daughter quickly picked up on how to make the labels, I put her in charge of them. Exploring the different designs and fonts was actually pretty cool. I purchased two different color tapes so far. I will be purchasing more soon. We all love the convenience of this unit. I purchased the optional power cord which makes life so much easier. It has a space on my desk, where it will remain plugged in and ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lady DA

customer_reviews.title: EVERYTHING is labeled now. Everything.
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this to label racks & equipment at work, but found it pretty handy and ended up bringing it home. The multiple fonts, though limited, are nice to have. It's pretty easy to use. My son and I fight over who gets to use it. And now all the cords in the house are labeled - no more unplugging the speakers when you meant to unplug the phone charger!
customer_reviews.author: Anna B

customer_reviews.title: Label maker
customer_reviews.text: Was a little bigger than I thought it would actually be. It does not come with a ac cord. Have to buy that separately. Also no extra tape. So can only make small labels so far until I get the wider tape. A little complicated to use, but you can figure it out in about an hour if you have time. It does come with directions, but there are so many features it takes some time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G.

customer_reviews.title: Product came not working
customer_reviews.text: Product came in the mail and looked like a nice label maker, however we never were able to get it to work. We tried everything to no avail. This was a gift for my wife and by the time we received it, to the first time she needed it the grace period for returns had lapsed. Maybe the label maker would have fulfilled or wildest label making dreams, if it had worked. We shall never know. I guess we will shop for another one else where.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice quailty, somewhat clunky interface
customer_reviews.text: This product appears solidly built and the labels always come out smoothly with no errors (except for operator error). If all you use it for is simple two color labels, this will get the job done, no problems. My biggest issue is the user interface. Now that most of use have become accustomed to sizable color touch screens, the LabelWorks feels dated. It's not necessarily bad, but takes some getting used to. I wish it had a USB connection with a corresponding computer or smartphone app.
customer_reviews.author: mommabear

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, but complicated and pixelated print
customer_reviews.text: A nice entry-level label printer with indeed little white 'waste' compared to the brother and other current models, this still fails to be a great device. The LED display is passable, but Epson forgot to include true WYSIWYG capability; enabling you to see the fonts and so fort while selecting it, but NOT while typing, making it hard to see what finished print will look like. The print out is also extremely jaggy / pixelated, and print-out is slower compared to brother. A lot of functions, but the menu systems needs work.
customer_reviews.author: dosers

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you are an organizing maniac
customer_reviews.text: I love Epson LW-300 label maker. It has many options to add features to your labels - frames, pictures, different fonts. You can also purchase different color tapes. I am very pleased with my newly labeled paper filing system.
customer_reviews.author: Jan2

customer_reviews.title: ... present for my wife and it turned into her favorite gift. We have 2 children in school and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my wife and it turned into her favorite gift. We have 2 children in school and this thing is absolutely wonderful for labeling their stuff and the iron-on labels are genius and perfect for labeling their clothes and jackets
customer_reviews.author: Rick J. Majcher

customer_reviews.title: Difficult To Program
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice looking package and probably works very well once it is programmed but if you do not have 20/20 vision (I am in my late 70's and do not) you will have to get someone else to set it up for you. I spent my entire career as a designer and implementer of OS software but this device has me stymied I am sorry to say. Anyone out there have any helpful advice concerning initialization for this device? Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Ercillor

customer_reviews.title: Poor Printing
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews thought this product was going to be great. Bought as a gift and was disappointed to see how light the black printing was on clear labels I bought to go with it. Looked faded. Tried multiple times and still very light.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Device, Label Tape Adhesive Questionable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a brother unit that finally gave out on me. The unit itself is great! Tons of functions, very quiet printing and as others have said, it doesn't leave tons of wasted margin on each side of the text. The label tape that came with the unit though doesn't stick to certain materials as well as the Brother tape did. But on the flip side, the labels come off clean, unlike the Brother labels that could leave backing when you took them off. Could just be this specific tape, I'll update when I try a new roll if there is any improvement.
customer_reviews.author: G.P.

customer_reviews.title: No More Confusion At My House!
customer_reviews.text: Do you often wonder who you are? What your role is in life? Well, thanks to this magical machine, our family no longer struggles with those difficult questions. Santa brought my husband this label maker for Christmas, and we are all now correctly identified and labeled. Just the other day, I was staring confusedly at a short person in the kitchen, when I noticed he was labeled as 'son' '7 yr old' and 'Nick'. What a relief. Even as we speak, I am wearing tags identifying my person as 'wife' 'mom' and a name I can only assume is mine. Whew!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a very nice label maker. would reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Gogarden

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I will not buy this or another Epson product again. Great labelmaker....... until it broke a little longer than a year after I bought it. Battery does not stay charged so I need to use it plugged in at all times. Really annoying. Also Epson does not have any product support for this item so theres nobody who can help me out to get it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: miriam d whitehill

customer_reviews.title: Worst Label Maker Ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst lable maker ever. Not intuitive like the P-Touch machines are. I only bought because I needed glow in the dark tape and Epson was the only vendor who carried it. Besides being hard to use, the quality of the printing is inferior. Could not get a good print regardless of what font I tried. Very poor product.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Wisbrod

customer_reviews.title: Barely used it and now "motor error has turned it into a paper weight.
customer_reviews.text: Barely used it since I bought it. After using up the small sample tape cartridge it came with. I added a brand new one from epson and the unit now says "Motor Error". I contacted epson support for help and got no support since its out of warranty. Piece of junk, and epson was no better.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used my new labeler alot yet, but I was pleased with all the different fonts, pictures, and things it can do. I was a little worried I'd have trouble learning how to use it, but a couple hours after taking it out of the box I had labels for my newly organized spice cupboard all made and on the bins. It was fun to use the little pepper, onion, cake pictures to jazz up the labels! The features I like about this labeller are: the QWERTY keypad (did not want alphabetical), it's portable,small, quiet, fast, seems to be easy on the amount of tape it uses, and the backs peel off the tape easily.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Did not need manual to figure out so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: You can do so much with this: borders, symbols, smiley faces. So much more. Did not need manual to figure out so easy to use. The only thing I haven't tried so far is apparently you can save files so you can store phrases to print. Love this product, great price. Comes with sample tape so make sure you pick up tape if you have a big job to do. The only downside is the tape can be expensive, but that goes for all brands of tape.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I do like it but I haven't used it much yet
customer_reviews.text: I do like it but I haven't used it much yet . I do have the hang of navigating it yet , but it has good lettering and when I get the hang of this labeling machine I am sure I will use it quite a bit !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile little product
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife for Christmas as she was looking to get more organized. She really likes it. I waited to buy extra tapes until she started using it more so I would know exactly what she would use and needed. So far she has been happy with the stock labels as you have a lot of options for adding little icons and change the fonts, it has most of the creativity that she needs. She has used it a lot to label the kids toy tubs, containers in the linen closet and even all of our charging cords. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a week, then gives me an error of "motor malfunction". Unfortunately, I didn't use it right away so its past return date. Be wary.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Appreciated only after a spell
customer_reviews.text: My initial impression was that this is a gadget with too many options and too small type on the directions. (I'm ole). After initial setup, I find that I use the same settings 99% of the time and the special effects only seldom. I appreciate the amount of options now. I think the split back tapes are good idea. Makes peeling the backing easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sambeaux

customer_reviews.title: It labels stuff, ya know.
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in a label maker because I enrolled my toddler into daycare. With the many other children and few belongings she needed (bottles, cups, snack cups, jacket, shoes), I thought it would be a good investment to also use when she needed school supplies in a few more years. Very easy to use. I don't use every function it has, but it's been very useful. I've used it sparingly since August. Maybe once a month or two months with just a handful of 2-3" labels at a time. It's held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: C.Redmon

customer_reviews.title: What a great gadget! Just be aware you have to buy ...
customer_reviews.text: thought it would be complicated, but after reviewing the instructions for just a minute or two, I was making labels left and right! Got my entire file cabinet whipped into shape in no time. What a great gadget! Just be aware you have to buy six AAA batteries separately, and/or a power cord, as those 2 items do not come with it. And I think I had to order the label tape too.
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: Like the labeler
customer_reviews.text: Like the labeler. It's easy enough to work, but doesn't come with a plug, so just runs on batteries and as I tend to go a few weeks between uses, it always seems to need new batteries every time I go to use it. Also, it goes through tape quickly. There is quite a bit of tape waste on either end of the printing. The cost of two replacement cartridges is as much as a new labeler (that came with a mini cartridge). Seems like there has to be a better choice out there.
customer_reviews.author: KazzyK

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Home Tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Epson LW-300 after doing a lot of reading up on the other label makers in this class. All I can say is that I chose right. At first I thought it was broken on my first print attempt because I saw it saying printing but I heard no printing sounds. This thing is silent as the night! The labels were centered, bright, bold, and minimal wastage of label. Savings here! Some might say it's little slow, but really who's in a hurry to make labels. My first impression is it's a great buy for the price. Will update if that changes.
customer_reviews.author: Aleem

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy any of the adapters advertised for this product on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This labelmaker works well but really sucks up the battery juice. I ordered an adapter advertised on Amazon as suitable for this product. It did not work with it. Therefore, I ordered another different adapter advertised for this product which was a bad move; I had to return it too because it did not fit the labelmaker. If you want to avoid inserting six batteries each time the labelmaker runs out, go to the Epson site and order an adapter from it. I rated this product with 4 stars because of the adapter issue; the labelmaker itself works well.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Montana

customer_reviews.title: Many fonts, many sizes
customer_reviews.text: Great product, versatile, and handles many types of printing. Whether narrow font, or wide font, this printer handles it like a pro! Great printing, simple feed, and cutting of tape. Mine did not jam from day 1! You can pick the size of letters too. As well as upper, lower case, and a wide variety of symbols. Whether labeling for a small calendar, or a large cabinet...best investment for the job performance of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Passport2success

customer_reviews.title: Neat labler with good assortment of tape available
customer_reviews.text: I like the small compact styling. The tape loads easily, and offers crisp fonts and a selection of symbols. Two minuses: first, to keep it small, the designers made accessing menu options complicated. Second, the unit does not include an AC wall adaptor, which seems to be available only through the manufactuer, and at a hefty price. It requires 6AAA batteries without the adaptor. Newer models use AAs, an improvement, especially if you want to use rechargable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent selection of characters and print fonts
customer_reviews.text: Excellent selection of characters and print fonts. Not the cheapest label maker by any means, but you get what you pay for. I almost gave it 2 or 3 stars, simply because it causes new found addictions of labeling. Took me a few months from purchase to leave a review, as I was busy going around labeling everything. Yes, it is just that easy....
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: The labels are fine. I bought it on sale so the price ...
customer_reviews.text: The labels are fine. I bought it on sale so the price was ok. The directions on how to load and use are not great. I was a little frustrated so hence the 3 stars. I don't consider myself an amazing do it yourselfer but I am pretty good at reading and following directions.
customer_reviews.author: ABThomasTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Just works.
customer_reviews.text: It's not pretty or anything, but it does its job extremely well. Plenty of special characters for your non-ASCII needs. The tiny amount of demo tape that comes with it doesn't come off before I want it, and is easy to remove when I do want it, even several months after application. I've only used maybe four of these in my life, but this is by far the best of them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hills

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine for home offices or at work. I use it all the time for file folder and hanging folders and just to stay organized. The different font syles and sizes really make it a lot easier and the label paper is easy to change and, in my opinion, not expensive. I use batteries in mine and have yet to have to change them. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Still printing....
customer_reviews.text: Have had this device for 3 years and it is still going strong. Super easy to use and the ink seems to last for a long very long time. Very happy with the durability and quality of printer. It has a nice weight to it... you can tell it is not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: PMO

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Does everything I need and more! It's a bit tricky first starting but once you figure it out, it's incredibly easy!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny AmaZ0N

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker with so many nifty little effects that can be added in! Use one or two lines of text, add borders, add icons, and tons of other effects and let your creative genius shine. It's easy to use, though it looks a bit daunting at first. And for the price (only about $10 more than standard label markers), I think the slightly higher price is well-worth all the extra bells and whistles you get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker, came in handy when labeling my son's school supplies for Kindergarten! Each individual pencil and crayon had to be labeled and the Epson made the job fast and easy with sizing, print preview, fun fonts, frames, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn T

customer_reviews.title: A purchase I don’t regret
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for several years and I love it so much! I use it for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Knerq

customer_reviews.title: I like this brand because of the options of buying different ...
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues and contacted Epson and they sent me a new one after some time troubleshooting with customer service. Works well but still have to figure out how to change font and size, will write back. I like this brand because of the options of buying different sticker types (iron on, and glow in the dark)
customer_reviews.author: Joana

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first label maker so I didn't know what to expect. I bought it to label spice jars. I also bought an extra cartridge of white labels (which is somewhat pricey), but the cartridge that came with the label maker was sufficient for labeling 40 spice jars with still a lot left over. The user manual is well written and the buttons are easy to understand. The built-in cutter is a great feature. Overall, it's a great gadget for home use.
customer_reviews.author: N David

customer_reviews.title: Still going
customer_reviews.text: nearly 3 years later and still works. I love to write reviews on things that last.
customer_reviews.author: Stewie

customer_reviews.title: Label Here, Label There
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I would like to say that this product came a day early. I was so excited but I expected to be disappointed because I knew it was too good to be true. However the only bad thing about this label maker is that it requires 6 batteries to work because it didn't come with a charging cable. My disappointment for the extreme number of batteries vanish as I simply put the labels in the label maker and started labeling away! This thing is so simple and easy and very fun! Now I have labels all in my house and I cant stop myself from creating more!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great little label maker!
customer_reviews.text: This label maker has a wide variety of tapes, fonts, symbols, etc. I have used this several months and still have not completly used or explored all of the options. The batteries last longer than most other label makers as well. The tape is all scored on the back to help take the protective backing making it an easy application!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Leatherneck

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a label maker before and decided to purchase this after reading the great reviews. This device is so neat and creative, I love it! I also like that you can change the color tape (instead of sticking to basic white). For someone like myself (a new user), I found that this was very very easy to operate. A definite must!!
customer_reviews.author: Lahela K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Label Maker!
customer_reviews.text: What a great, little label maker! Very extensive ability in changing fonts, sizes, number of lines of print on the tape. Keep the instruction sheet handy, you'll need it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Robison

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough to use that even my 5 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Not such an advanced label maker but I bought this one to label some of my son's stuff and some jars and containers around the kitchen and house. Does the job. Easy enough to use that even my 5 year old can type and print with it. Def. worth it especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TombRaider

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I bought this to label my teas and spices that I keep in mason jars. It works very well, I can type on it relatively fast and it prints out. There are several options to choose from which if I feel frisky I may try at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Label Maker
customer_reviews.text: A great label maker for everything. This label maker gives the user numerous options to choose from while creating a label. You will have options from frames, letter sizes, letter fonts, horizontal or vertical label, different sysmbols, etc. Along with these options, there are a variety of tapes that can be installed so that you can change your font color or label background color. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Codi L Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine is really nice; love the fact you can print in different font sizes. For those who complained it was hard to use...might want to try reading the instructions as they explain it all and it is not hard to use once you know what buttons are for what. Don't forget to order the batteries so you can use it..this was the hardest part of the whole experience...but again if your read the instructions it is made clear.
customer_reviews.author: snorkie

customer_reviews.title: Works well !
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, with a good set of instructions. Takes 15 minutes to get the basics down, then it makes nice labels in a wide variety of stiles. The labels are easy to peel and stick, and seem to be quite water resistant. Still get an extra 3/8" at each end of each label - setting label length a bit shorter than what I get from "auto" length just seems to get a "label too short for text" message. No big deal - snip it off !
customer_reviews.author: KingRat

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: Great label maker. I was making labels as soon as I put the batteries in! Anyone who says this is complicated needs brain surgery. It's simple, and makes great looking, easy to read labels. I like that I can put in little symbols too. Seems well constructed, and fits in the hands nicely. I look forward to using this for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Ehrhardt

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT LABELER
customer_reviews.text: When i got this labeler i was so excited to label my gemstone jars. It was easy to use and very light easy to understand the directions. The only complaint i have is that i wish the tape would come in a 1/4 inch width instead of a 1/2 inch width. It got to my house pretty quick and was packaged nice and secure no damage occurred while shipping.. All n all i am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Works Great & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: No instructions necessary with this purchase. It's very user-friendly and works perfectly for me. I wanted to print labels for homemade kombucha bottles, spice jars and files in the office, and it works great for all of the above. I ordered an extra tape to use when the one that came with the label maker runs out. So far, I've labeled quite a few things and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: lsutigeralumna

customer_reviews.title: This was recommended by Do It On A Dime on YouTube and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by Do It On A Dime on YouTube and it is the first label maker I've had (my third) that doesn't waste any label tape on every label. It also has a variety of fonts and frames so that, if the need arises, I can make very nice looking labels. A good price, doesn't waste label tape, pretty labels... what more could I ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: like many, many other products
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up...label maker does not come with an AC Adapter cord. I checked the product page and towards the bottom of page just above Product Description, it tells you what is in the box. I never thought I would have to look for that. Although I know it is battery operated, I assumed an adapter cord came with it, like many, many other products. Never assume. Label maker itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G

customer_reviews.title: gave me a useless problem number
customer_reviews.text: I found it difficult to make two lines instead of one. I called the company, who could not answer my question either and instead, gave me a useless problem number. They said they would call me back to discuss and inform me how to make the changes, as the directions included with the label maker was not clear. No one ever called me back and I still cannot get the label maker to change from one line to two, even though it says it is on two lines. They need to make this easier to use and the directions more clear.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Stone

customer_reviews.title: But I love to label
customer_reviews.text: Had a brother p-touch (which didn't last very long) and replaced it with this. Decent machine, prints a little slower and the tape (not sure if I can get different tape) doesn't have nearly as much stickiness as the p-touch did. And it'a a little more flimsy. Can't really say much about the reliability (since I just got it). But I love to label!
customer_reviews.author: Car

customer_reviews.title: Don't try rechargeables
customer_reviews.text: I guess it flipped, so the info. I meant to put on the printer went on the cartridge, so here goes again. Labeler didn't work with my rechargeable AAs, so I bought regular AAs and it worked just fine. I didn't do anything fancy yet--haven't read the directions--but used it for 36 labels for my flower bed by just the "intuitive" use of the machine. I'm well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Whitman

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this. Quick and easy to use. Labels looks nice and the cutter works very well. I've labeled over 50 cables so far, no problems. I like that I can print multiple lines on the same label if I want, change font, and lots more.
customer_reviews.author: Katie K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the "frame" feature. Definitely review the instructions before using just so you get the hand of where the different settings are and how they work. Once you use it, you will be pleased. It is also great at cutting close to the end of your label so you don't have a bunch of wasted tape at the end of each. Great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Ross

customer_reviews.title: Not so happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am somewhat disappointed in this label maker as it isn't as intuitive as my previous one and it seems like when I have the settings how I want them they disappear for following labels and I have to reset each time. Not as much flexibility in size of print, you can only set for one line or two. It may do all kinds of marvelous things but I can't seem to make it do what I want. Also the screen is really hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: M. James

customer_reviews.title: Nifty label maker
customer_reviews.text: It is a great label maker. I use it mainly for filing and labeling items in the office. Recommend it. I read some reviews that the sample tape was crappy but I did not have that experience. I have made 10 labels with it so far and it is not finished yet, and I mean labels that says "ABCD Credit Card Statements" etc so pretty long
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, worth every penny I paid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Cyber Monday for $10. It is very cool with all the graphics and fonts that you can do. You can do thousands of combinations with this device. I also used it in the office to label devices and cables and this guy held up really but really good. I also print labels for my friends for special occasions and everybody loves it. If you get a good deal, buy one immediately. The only drawback is that the labels itself are bit expensive..
customer_reviews.author: Sena

customer_reviews.title: Excellent labeler, it can be a little complicated to ...
customer_reviews.text: wish it had the power cord. Excellent labeler, it can be a little complicated to run, the simpler version might be better.
customer_reviews.author: Mul

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Variety of fonts. Sizing works well. The ribbon option is amazing! I've used the ribbons for gift tags and labels on baskets. It remembers my settings and is easy to use. UPDATE Have been using this for several years now and still going strong. The white tape is durable and sticks well to a variety of items. I have been very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal on this
customer_reviews.text: Works great, gave my smaller labeler to my sister, kept this one because I really like the large lettering on the labels
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Specht

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker. Great for home office or home use. Easy to use and clear instructions! Many options for text size, font styles and even plenty of cute designs. Comes with standard white tape, I prefer clear tape which I purchased separately on Amazon. Uses 6 AAA batteries which are NOT included. You can purchase an adapter separately from the Epson site. Light weight and makes Labeling Simple and fun!
customer_reviews.author: lilmama

customer_reviews.title: Quit debating, just buy it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed. The spit down the middle of the back paper on the label alone is fantastically easy to use. The ease of use for changing font size, number of lines (1 or 2) and character spacing is great. Don't lose track of the single page user guide so you can use the advanced features like the boarders and icons.
customer_reviews.author: Picky picky picky

customer_reviews.title: You think they could have programmed it in so it did not attempt those combinations so you did not waste the ink/labeling just t
customer_reviews.text: Does not print correctly maybe 1/3 the time making so you have to redue & find the problem, wasting alot of expensive ink/labeling. MANY combinations of features do not work when used together. You think they could have programmed it in so it did not attempt those combinations so you did not waste the ink/labeling just to find out. Nice when it works....
customer_reviews.author: Rashele Felina

customer_reviews.title: short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I loved this label maker because it was so easy to use, but about a year and a half later it just suddenly stopped working on me. It won't turn on despite how many times I change the batteries. But, I'm ordering it again! Mostly because I have a bunch of the tape refills at home and well, I like it, even though it died on me. So I'm just warning you, these don't last very long!
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than a year ago and it's already broke. The batteries are a pain to put in and they seem to go bad very quickly. The labels were nice when it worked but rather confusing to figure out the different fonts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice labels, but a brick after 18 months - ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice labels, but a brick after 18 months - if you see the ' motor error' sign then that may indicate the end.. Actually $66 in 2013, now $28.88! Guess I'll just buy another one - maybe at $28.88 they have found a price point...
customer_reviews.author: Socks349

customer_reviews.title: Great product that fits in the hand nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Love this labeler. My first and my last. Portable. Small. Awesome. The only con is that you do have to read the instructions carefully to understand how to use all of the features (like changing case, changing font, adding symbols, printing on 2 rows, etc.), it's not intuitive. But once you get it down, it's easier.
customer_reviews.author: DMilesNY

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price, text resolution a little low.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy good price. The resolution of the text is a little poor. I wasn't expecting that. Depending on what you are using it for, probably not a big deal. You can read it just fine. I use it for business, so people do see it, so I would have liked it to be a little nicer looking. I have gone through the initial tape and had no problems, so as far as reliability, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Baalbergen

customer_reviews.title: Wastes less tape and loaded with printing options!
customer_reviews.text: Can't live without a label maker and I love this one-mainly because it wastes less tape at the ends and has tons of printing options. I highly recommend it for all your labeling needs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Epson LabelWorks LW-300 Label Maker (C51CB69010)
product_meta.description:
Style:LW-300

LABELWORKS LW-300 LABEL PRINTER
WHY BUY?
TAKE ORDINARY TO EXTRAORDINARY
 The EPSON LabelWorks LW-300 label printer is where organization meets imagination. No longer restricted by simple options, you can choose from a huge range of symbols, frames and fonts. With dozens of tapes in a variety of styles, borders, sizes and colors, your creativity can be boundless. LW-300 also is efficient (save up to 30 self-created label designs with built-in memory to prevent redundant work) and more mindful of supplies (dramatically smaller lead margins mean up to 60% less label waste). It’s perfect for creating professional-looking labels at home or in the office — for files, storage bins, household items, clothing and just about anything else. Explore the amazingly versatile LW-300 label maker and celebrate your creative expression. 

Enlarge 



WHAT THE PRESS IS SAYING:

"This battery-powered machine [Epson LabelWorks LW-300] performs basic label printing, offering various fonts, type styles, and a wide variety of symbols. It's highly portable and operates totally PC free." ~PCMag.com, (March 22, 2012)





DO MORE…

At Home 
At Work 
At Play 

Folders 
Tags 
Clothing 
Containers 



AMAZING VARIETY
The LW-300 offers 14 fonts, 10 styles, 300+ built-in symbols, over 75 frames and glow-in-the-dark and reflective options. With so many choices for creative expression, you’ll finally have labels that catch up to your imagination.






ADDITIONAL FEATURES
 * Amazing variety — 14 fonts, 10 styles, 300+ built-in symbols, over 75 frames and more
 * Less waste — smaller lead margin compared to other brands, for up to 60% less lead margin waste
 * Large built-in memory — store up to 30 files
 * Fits up to two lines of text — up to 12 mm (0.5") wide tape
 * Easy to use — automatically printed with a split back for easy and fast peeling
 * Whisper quiet — prints labels without distracting those around you
 * Supports seven languages — set to the language of your choice
 * Specialty labels — glow-in-the-dark, reflective tapes, iron-on and decorative tapes for scrapbooking and more
 * Packaging Specifications (W x D x H) — Dimensions: 7.7" x 3.1" x 7.8" and Weight 1.52 lb.

Enlarge 



WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 * LW-300 Label Printer
 * 12mm (0.47”) Black on White LC sample tape cassette
 * User’s Guide and Warranty Card

EPSON TAPE SUPPLIES
 * Standard Black on White, 12mm (LC-4WBN9)
 * Standard Black on White, 18mm (LC-5WBN9)
 * Clear Black on Clear, 12mm (LC-4TBN9)
 * Strong Adhesive Black on Yellow, 18mm (LC-5YBW9)
 * Iron on (Fabric) Black on White, 12mm (LC-4WBQ5)
 * Standard Gold on Black, 12mm (LC-4BKP9)
 * Standard Red on White, 12mm (LC-4WRN9)
 * Standard Blue on White, 12mm (LC-4WLN9)
 * Clear Gold on Clear, 12mm (LC-4TKN9)
 * *Visit Epson.com for more tape options 





LABELWORKS SERIES
Take ordinary to extraordinary with LabelWorks label printers, they make it easy to create customized labels for files, storage bins, household items, clothing, scrapbooking and more. With a wide range of fonts, styles, frames and specialty modes, these easy-to-use products offer amazing versatility. And, they ensure less waste with smaller margins compared to other brands.
feature_bullets: Amazing variety - 14 fonts, 10 styles, 300+ built-in symbols, over 75 frames and more
Less waste - smaller margins compared to other brands for up to 62% less waste
Large built-in memory - store up to 30 files
Easy to use - automatically printed with a split back for easy and fast peeling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars856 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
